bugs.title: CVE-2015-5622 CVE-2015-5623 wordpress: cross-site scripting and permission issue fixed in wordpress 4.2.3

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-5622 CVE-2015-5623 wordpress: cross-site scripting and permission issue fixed in wordpress 4.2.3

long_desc.thetext:
A cross-site scripting vulnerability, which could allow users with the Contributor or Author role to compromise a site, was found in WordPress 4.2.2 and earlier. This flaw was assigned CVE-2015-5622.

A second flaw was found which could allow a user with Subscriber permissions to create a draft through Quick Draft. This flaw was assigned CVE-2015-5623.

Both issues were fixed in WordPress 4.2.3.

CVE assignment:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2015/q3/187

Upstream patches:

CVE-2015-5622 - https://core.trac.wordpress.org/changeset/33359
CVE-2015-5623 - https://core.trac.wordpress.org/changeset/33357

External References:

https://wordpress.org/news/2015/07/wordpress-4-2-3/

Created wordpress tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1246398]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1246399]
wordpress-4.2.4-1.fc21 has been pushed to the Fedora 21 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
wordpress-4.2.4-1.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
wordpress-4.2.4-1.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
wordpress-4.2.4-1.el5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
wordpress-4.2.4-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

bugs.title: CVE-2015-2213 CVE-2015-5730 CVE-2015-5731 CVE-2015-5732 CVE-2015-5733 CVE-2015-5734 wordpress: cross-site scripting vulnerabilities and a potential SQL injection

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-2213 CVE-2015-5730 CVE-2015-5731 CVE-2015-5732 CVE-2015-5733 CVE-2015-5734 wordpress: cross-site scripting vulnerabilities and a potential SQL injection

long_desc.thetext:
WordPress version 4.2.4 fixes three cross-site scripting vulnerabilities and a potential SQL injection that could be used to compromise a site.

External References:

https://codex.wordpress.org/Version_4.2.4

Created wordpress tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1250584]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1250585]

From http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2015/q3/290 :

"""
    https://core.trac.wordpress.org/changeset/33555
    https://core.trac.wordpress.org/changeset/33556
    "Comments: IDs are integers"


Use CVE-2015-2213 only for this SQL injection issue.


    https://core.trac.wordpress.org/changeset/33535
    https://core.trac.wordpress.org/changeset/33536
    "Customizer: Use hash_equals() for widgets" aka "a fix for a
    potential timing side-channel attack"


Use CVE-2015-5730.


    https://core.trac.wordpress.org/changeset/33542
    https://core.trac.wordpress.org/changeset/33543
    "Heartbeat: Ensure post locks are released" aka "prevents an attacker
    from locking a post from being edited"


Use CVE-2015-5731.



    cross-site scripting vulnerabilities
    https://core.trac.wordpress.org/changeset/33529
    "Nav menus: Consistent titles in widgets"

Use CVE-2015-5732.

    https://core.trac.wordpress.org/changeset/33540
    https://core.trac.wordpress.org/changeset/33541
    "Nav menus: Adjust redundant titles in accessibility helpers"

Use CVE-2015-5733.

    https://core.trac.wordpress.org/changeset/33549
    "Themes: Fix some broken links in the legacy theme preview."

Use CVE-2015-5734.
"""
Updating aliases accordingly.
wordpress-4.2.4-1.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
wordpress-4.2.4-1.fc21 has been pushed to the Fedora 21 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
wordpress-4.2.4-1.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
wordpress-4.2.4-1.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
wordpress-4.2.4-1.el5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
wordpress-4.2.4-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

notes:
**WordPress 4.2.4 Security and Maintenance Release**

WordPress 4.2.4 is now available. This is a security release for all previous versions and we strongly encourage you to update your sites immediately.

This release addresses six issues, including three cross-site scripting vulnerabilities and a potential SQL injection that could be used to compromise a site, which were discovered by Marc-Alexandre Montpas of Sucuri, Helen Hou-Sandí of the WordPress security team, Netanel Rubin of Check Point, and Ivan Grigorov. It also includes a fix for a potential timing side-channel attack, discovered by Johannes Schmitt of Scrutinizer, and prevents an attacker from locking a post from being edited, discovered by Mohamed A. Baset.

Our thanks to those who have practiced responsible disclosure of security issues.

WordPress 4.2.4 also fixes four bugs. For more information, see:
 the release notes or consult the list of changes.
* the release notes: https://codex.wordpress.org/Version_4.2.4
* the list of changes: https://core.trac.wordpress.org/log/branches/4.2?rev=33573&stop_rev=33396

**WordPress 4.2.3 Security and Maintenance Release**

WordPress 4.2.3 is now available. This is a security release for all previous versions and we strongly encourage you to update your sites immediately.

WordPress versions 4.2.2 and earlier are affected by a cross-site scripting vulnerability, which could allow users with the Contributor or Author role to compromise a site. This was initially reported by Jon Cave and fixed by Robert Chapin, both of the WordPress security team, and later reported by Jouko Pynnönen.

We also fixed an issue where it was possible for a user with Subscriber permissions to create a draft through Quick Draft. Reported by Netanel Rubin from Check Point Software Technologies.

Our thanks to those who have practiced responsible disclosure of security issues.

WordPress 4.2.3 also contains fixes for 20 bugs from 4.2. For more information, see:
* the release notes: https://codex.wordpress.org/Version_4.2.3
* the list of changes: https://core.trac.wordpress.org/log/branches/4.2?rev=33382&stop_rev=32430
title: wordpress-4.2.4-1.el6
